title: Best Fonts of 2006 ( Typographica )
content:
[http://typographica.org/001103.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128121342/http:/typographica.org/001103.php "http://typographica.org/001103.php")

Has this been discussed? Did I miss it?

I did a search today but all I found was a Typographica RSS feed echoed on Typophile

 [‹ Futura Pronunciation?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128121342/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35311 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sans Serifs - What're the differences ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128121342/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35301 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Eben Sorkin

comments.content:
I thought the fonts listed were outstanding. I wish I could get them all, but my fontaholics group did an intervention on me.

Sharon

Yes, it was mentioned, but somewhat hidden.  
The thread is on page 5 or something already of the General Discussions board. Here’s the link: [http://typophile.com/node/35056](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128121342/http:/typophile.com/node/35056 "http://typophile.com/node/35056")
I hope you’ll see fit to discuss it right there on Typographica. We’ve fixed the comments and the form should work properly.

I tried to leave a comment, Stephen, but it wouldn’t let me.

Sharon

So that is why the comments are stuck at ’10’ perhaps...

Stephen, I thought the list hadn’t perhaps been discussed enough generally there - or here.
Oh no, Sharon. Can you explain what the error was?

Something about the comment not being allowed. (I swear it was nice!) I don’t remember exactly. I’ve tried looking in my history but can’t find it.

Sharon

Sharon, Stewf, I was able to submit a comment.

OSX, 10.4; Safari 3.0.2

I guess it worked. I got the message:

Your comment has been received and held for approval by the blog owner.

IE7 Win XP
Were you talking dirty in your comment, Sharon? Naughty!
